Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 06:03PM - edited Apr 19, 2008 06:03PM by Kim32 I am concerned that a needle or core biopsy might miss a cancer.  That is why I might like to just have the whole lump removed to be tested.  Also, then I won't be constantly worrying about it and grabbing at it and making it sore all the time.
Posts.Title: Drains & Time Off Work For Lumpectomy Kim32 Solihull
Drains & Time Off Work For Lumpectomy Kim32 Solihull

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2008 10:30AM - edited Apr 26, 2008 02:55PM by Kim32 I have not been diagnosed with cancer.  I have not had a biopsy on the lump yet so that is probably why they aren't doing a SNB, since my lumpectomy is to test the entire lump for cancer.  I don't want to do any needle biopsy since I just want the whole thing removed.   One more thing I have to ask you ladies:  How many of you underwent an MRI prior to having a lumpectomy done?  My surgeon said he would write me an order for one if I wanted one, but he said he felt comfortable doing the lumpectomy without one, and that MRI's can produce a lot of false positives.  My mammogram and ultrasound were both negative and my left breast is a little thicker and more tender than my right and the lump can be clearly felt.  I guess I am just concerned of the possibility that there might be more going on in the breast than that lump, but i'm not sure how common that is.  I am 32 years old, and a little nervous about having an MRI done, but I also want to do what's best for me.
Posts.Title: Drains & Time Off Work For Lumpectomy Kim32 Solihull

Posts.Content: May 9, 2008 11:21AM Kim32 wrote: Hi Ked, I have to go get my first Breast MRI in 2 hours!  I am very nervous, but I hope everything goes ok.  I am mostly scared of the contrast dye, but most people on here say it's not too bad.  I also worry what will happen if I end up having false positives.  I don't want to have to go through any unnecessary biopsy's.  My surgeon and I am mainly concerned about the upper outer quadrant of my left breast where the breast is thicker and tender all the time.  Non-cyclical tenderness.  I hope for a clear result.  I go back to the surgeon next Thursday, but I may call early next week to see if I can get my results sooner.
